CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 15, 1957, pg. 3, reads: "OFF TO NATIONAL FINALS - These Pittsburgh marble champions and their coaches will leave on Sunday for the national marble championship matches to be held next week in Asbury Park. Left to right: James Fuller, Manchester School Playground; Joseph Eugene Gordon, champion, Broadhead Recreation Center, and Adam Schillinger, director, Broadhead Center. - Harris Photo."  Cutline of cropped version of image also published on June 29, 1957, pg. A10, reads: "FAIL IN TITLE BID - Pittsburgh's two entries in national marbles championship matches failed to reach the semi-finals at Asbury Park.  But James Fuller, left, led his league to the three days and fell back to second place on the fourth day.  Joseph Eugene Gordon, the city champion, finished third.  Fuller represented Manchester Playground, and Gordon was entered by Broadhead Recreation Center. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of James Fuller, Donald Myers, 1957 city of Pittsburgh marbles champion Joseph Eugene Gordon, and Adam Schillinger, posed in office
